programme.title: Bob Esponja

programme.title: Bob Esponja
programme.desc: Bob Esponja olvida quien es él cuando pierde su etiqueta de identidad; Plankton celebra los 25 años tratando de robar la receta secreta del restaurant Krabby Patty.

programme.title: Bob Esponja

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A customer of the flower shop names Janet in his will, and she receives a vase. His nephew, Philip, an art collector, visits Janet, and Jack thinks he lied about the value of the vase and is trying to get it back.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack meets an attractive stewardess, Vicky Bradford; but between her father and her dates, she doesn't seem to have time for Jack. Janet announces her engagement to Philip, while Jack is jealous and lovesick.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky wants a job in Houston and encourages her, causing her to think he wants to end their relationship. She interrupts Janet's wedding to find out why. They make up and the ceremony resumes. Jack proposes and is stunned by Vicky's refusal.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Vicky explains that she is afraid of marriage and suggests to Jack that they live together. Jack reluctantly agrees. They are toasting their first night together in their new apartment when they are interrupted by Mr. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: In order to convince their landlord, Mr. Roper, that there is nothing going on between them and their new male roommate, Chrissy and Janet tell him that Jack is gay.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Chrissy's visiting mother, not knowing that the girls have rented the spare room to Jack, causes havoc when she decides to spend the night with them.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Roper feels convinced that his niece will be safe going out with Jack, and Jack would rather be with Janet and Chrissy celebrating Janet's birthday, until he sees the niece.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack's fast-talking friend, Larry, gives Jack and the girls a puppy and the kids go to all lengths keeping this from Roper who forbids animals in his building.

programme.title: Three's Company

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: Mr. Trendell, the president of the Hooterville Phone Company, hands the company over to a delighted Oliver. But after a day of crossed wires and a switchboard repairman with some loose connections of his own, Oliver is ready to call it quits.

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: For the first time, Oliver has a successful crop that needs picking. His tomatoes have grown beautifully. But matters at the phone company continue to divide his precious time, so Oliver looks for an interested buyer to take the company off his hands.

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: Being president of the Hooterville Phone Company has been a rude awakening for Oliver. The switchboard operator is now calling him at five in the morning! After a bevy of new complaints from unhappy customers, Oliver has just about had enough.

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: One might think that when Eb takes a vacation, things around the farm might go more smoothly. But when Eb elopes, leaving his cousin Walter to take his place, it turns out to be a horrible idea. Walter barely knows a weed from a hole in the ground!

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: Lisa is reminded that she stored a birthday present for Oliver years ago: a genuine Stavinsky. But what is it? It's a modern art sculpture that is two parts plumbing pipes, one part tire chains, and one part birdbath. Oliver calls it The Thing.

programme.title: Green Acres
programme.desc: The continually evolving story of how Lisa (Eva Gabor) and Oliver (Oliver) fell in love gets yet another version in this delightful episode. But one thing is for sure: Lisa and Oliver are just as in love today as the day when he fell out of the sky.
